column5: I just talked to the manager of our lodge (Ball Lake Lodge) and he said there is someone new running the marina. He said that he's a real go-getter and he's done a lot of work on the road to the marina (Tommy's Road), which it desperately needed.....should make it much easier to get down there. We leave Tuesday....cannot wait, weather looks decent so far!!
Talked to the lodge we are going thru and they alos said the marina is under new management. They also mentioned that prices for everything at the marina went up too. We leave on Saturday
BigStorm, Let us know about the prices and road condition at the marina! We are heading up in August. Thanks.

With the ice going off in this area about 2 weeks ago, anyone know what the water levels are like? Heading up in 31 days, just wondering what it might be like this year. I have seen it fluxate 8 to 10 ft in this area

Let me know how you do up there, we are heading to Lount in a couple of months, lount flows into separation. Just curious to see how you do. I know they got alot of snow and ice this year so I would think water will be hi. Good luck
water here on the winnipeg river in keewatin is about 3 feet below the high water mark if that helps any.

I'm heading up to Ball Lake on the English River in 4 weeks.....can't wait!! I sent an e-mail to our lodge regarding the water levels up there but haven't heard anything as yet, I'll let you know what I find out!!
Heading up on 6/18, wondering if anyone has been up in that area yet. I havent heard much on the water levels other than they had a lot of snow over the winter and a lot of rain in the spring
I just got back from guiding 3 days on the English and the water level are a little high..which kept the walleye sitting in 2-4ft of water....but they were going gang busters when I did find them.
I've been reading about threads on Lount and have read about cabin 14, where is cabin 14???????
Anyone know if Rodney is still running the Marina? The number we had for him doesnt work anymore. Might have to come up with plan B forlive minnows and ice (no idea what plan B is yet though)
I'm pretty sure it's someone else running it this year...I can get u the info tomorrow before I leave for Delaney Lake Lodge.
